com.arunsoft.commonutils

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arunsoft.commonutils.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for working with files

    This class consists of static methods for working with files. Methods for copying, reading and writing files are available. Most methods indirectly use methods from StreamUtils. This is just for convenience. :)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      Copies File from src to dest
      static void copy(java.lang.String srcPath, java.lang.String destPath)
      Sane as copy(File src, File dest) but this takes the string path as argument
      static java.lang.String read(java.io.File in)
      Reads text file and returns the text as a String.
      static java.lang.String read(java.lang.String path)
      Same as read(File) but takes the path of the file as argument
      static java.lang.String[] readLines(java.io.File in)
      Reads the contents of the text file and returns them as array of lines.
      static java.lang.String[] readLines(java.lang.String path)
      Same as readLines(File) but takes the path of the file as argument
      static void write(java.io.File out, java.lang.String content)
      Writes the given String content to the text file.

                        java.io.File src,
                        @NonNull

                 throws java.io.IOException
        Copies File from src to dest
        Parameters:
        src - The source file (File to be copied)
        dest - The destination file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is an error either in reading or writing the file

      • copy

        public static void copy(@NonNull
                        java.lang.String srcPath,
                        @NonNull
                        java.lang.String destPath)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sane as copy(File src, File dest) but this takes the string path as argument
        Parameters:
        srcPath - Path of the source file
        destPath - Path of the destination file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is an error either in reading or writing the file

      • read

        public static java.lang.String read(@NonNull
                                    java.io.File in)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads text file and returns the text as a String. This assumes, default encoding.
        Parameters:
        in - The file to be read
        Returns:
        The String containing the content of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is an error reading the file

      • read

                                    java.lang.String path)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Same as read(File) but takes the path of the file as argument
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the file to be read
        Returns:
        The String containing the content of the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is an error reading the file

      • readLines

        public static java.lang.String[] readLines(@NonNull
                                           java.io.File in)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the contents of the text file and returns them as array of lines.
        Parameters:
        in - The text file to be read from
        Returns:
        An array of strings where each element represents a line in the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is an error reading the file

      • readLines

        public static java.lang.String[] readLines(@NonNull
                                           java.lang.String path)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Same as readLines(File) but takes the path of the file as argument
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the text file to be read from
        Returns:
        An array of strings where each element represents a line in the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is an error reading the file

      • write

        public static void write(@NonNull
                         java.io.File out,
                         java.lang.String content)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given String content to the text file.
        Parameters:
        out - The file to be written to

        Throws:
